desc: CSDE1, an RNA-binding protein, is mutated at low frequencies in various tumors

The CSDE1 gene encodes an RNA-binding protein. CSDE1 forms a complex with other proteins and is involved in mRNA turnover by influencing mRNA stability, deadenylation and subsequent translation (PMID: 11051545, 15314026). CSDE1 has been described as both a positive and negative regulator of apoptosis, depending on the cell lineage (PMID: 17086213). The CSDE1 gene is mutated at low frequencies in cancer (cBioPortal, MSKCC, Nov 2016).

articles.title: UNR, a new partner of poly(A)-binding protein, plays a key role in translationally coupled mRNA turnover mediated by the c-fos major coding-region determinant.

articles.reference: Grosset C et al. Cell. 2000 Sep 29;103(1)29-40.
